title: Drosophila Evolution in a Lab Set Member 2

content.question: For a population to be in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, certain conditions must be met. Which of the following best explains a characteristic of the fly populations that meets a condition of Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium?

choices.label: The population size of the flies was very small, which increases the likelihood of random mutations having a greater impact.
Since the flies were confined in chambers, they did not experience any migration, so no new alleles were introduced through migration.
Flies have a relatively short generation time and therefore are more likely to pass mutations to the next generation.
The different food sources may have exerted selective pressure on the fly populations, giving an advantage to certain flies.

content.answer: Since the flies were confined in chambers, they did not experience any migration, so no new alleles were introduced through migration.
